thread.title: Indonesian Shuttlers Vying for Denmark Open Title
thread.title_full: Indonesian Shuttlers Vying for Denmark Open Title

title: Indonesian Shuttlers Vying for Denmark Open Title
text:
INDEX Indonesian Shuttlers Vying for Denmark Open Title i Indonesian mixed doubles team Tontowi Ahmad, right, and Liliyana Natsir will face off with their South Korean counterparts in the Yonex Denmark Open finals on Sunday. (Antara Photo/Widodo S. Jusuf) By : Jakarta Globe | on 2:20 PM October 18, 2015 Category : Sports , Badminton , Featured 
Jakarta . Three of Indonesia's top shuttlers have entered the Yonex Denmark Open finals and will face their respective opponents for the top prize in the men's singles and mixed doubles tournaments on Sunday. 
Men's singles player Tommy Sugiarto beat Taiwan's Chou Tien Chen 21-8, 22-20 in a 42-minute semi-finals match on Friday and will next take on two-time World Champion Chen Long from China. 
Despite his upcoming opponent's impressive resume, Tommy said he is prepared to step onto the court on Sunday and give it his all. 
"Chen may have a more outstanding track record, but I will still do my best [on Sunday]," Tommy said as quoted by Antara news. "I will play better than I've ever played before." 
Chen is currently the world's number one shuttler, having won the bronze medal in London's 2012 Olympic games and securing 25 career titles. 
"He's far more accomplished than I am at both offensive and defensive play. I must be patient on the court," Tommy added. 
Tommy will join compatriots and mixed doubles pair Tontowi Ahmad and Liliyana Natsir in the finals' roster on Sunday. 
Tontowi and Liliyana bested China's Liu Cheng Bao Yixin on Saturday, scoring 21-18, 21-16 in the 44-minute semi-finals match, 
To win the Denmark Open title and a cash prize of $650,000, the pair must first beat Ko Sung Hyun Kim Ha Na from South Korea.
